question: 貨物船
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>freight</kanji> <kanji>thing</kanji>s <kanji>ship</kanji> is a boat that freights things. It's a <vocabulary>freighter</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own. The <ja>物</ja> takes its <ja>もつ</ja> reading, which makes sense since it sounds like <ja>持つ</ja>, which is "to hold." What is this freighter doing? It's holding freight! So, that's how you can remember that bit.
